tweets.text:
EXCLUSIVE: 
With the publication of my book today, I can finally announce: in the course of writing my book, my sources and I believe we uncovered the identity of the Ethereum's 2016 DAO hacker.

Tomorrow I'm recording an in-depth interview on Twenty One with 
@dgt10011
 and crypto equity analyst Mark Palmer. 

What would you like me to ask them?
The best part of this episode is that apparently my joke was censored

Base said it was for “everyone.”

Turns out it’s for content coins, millennial memes, and existential crises.

We invited 
@TrustlessState
 to join us and break down Zora’s big gamble, Bitcoin’s macro glow-up, and crypto’s identity.

Timestamps:
00:00 Intro
01:55 MicroStrategy

Wow, impressive phishing email. (The last screenshot shows what the "from" email really was.)

Stay safe, everyone
without market making and intermediary, btc strategy without redemption option would fail at the end. However, company making $BTC productive would benefit company treasury tremendously.

GBTC déjà vu?
@matthew_sigel
 says the biggest risk to the “Bitcoin strategy” companies is a collapsing premium.

When that goes, so does the business model.
I’m just a few weeks shy of my first decade in crypto and just appreciating how open-minded, non-judgmental, curious and funny crypto people are. You all are my jam

Your crypto staking is still at stake.

While the SEC and 5 states have dismissed their staking lawsuits, crypto owners in CA, NJ, MD, and WI have missed out on an estimated $90M+ in staking rewards and counting since June 2023.

But we will not stop fighting.
